title: The Complete Destruction Pathway
question_ar: Trace ALL distinct causal chains (minimum 3 hops) from الغفلة (heedlessness) to الكفر (disbelief). For each chain, provide: intermediate behaviors, verse evidence for each link, and tafsir from Ibn Kathir and Qurtubi confirming the causal relationship.
question_en: Trace ALL distinct causal chains (minimum 3 hops) from الغفلة (heedlessness) to الكفر (disbelief). For each chain, provide: intermediate behaviors, verse evidence for each link, and tafsir from Ibn Kathir and Qurtubi confirming the causal relationship.

title: Salvation's Shortest Path
question_ar: What is the minimum number of behavioral transformations required to move from الكبر (arrogance) to الإخلاص (sincerity)? Show the optimal path with verse evidence.
question_en: What is the minimum number of behavioral transformations required to move from الكبر (arrogance) to الإخلاص (sincerity)? Show the optimal path with verse evidence.

title: Circular Reinforcement Detection
question_ar: Identify all positive reinforcement cycles where behavior A→B→C→A, each strengthening the next. List all such cycles in the Quranic behavioral network with verse evidence.
question_en: Identify all positive reinforcement cycles where behavior A→B→C→A, each strengthening the next. List all such cycles in the Quranic behavioral network with verse evidence.

title: Negative Spiral Mapping
question_ar: Map all "downward spirals" - chains where each behavior causes a worse behavior, ultimately leading to one of: الكفر، النفاق، الخسران. Show the entry points and acceleration factors.
question_en: Map all "downward spirals" - chains where each behavior causes a worse behavior, ultimately leading to one of: الكفر، النفاق، الخسران. Show the entry points and acceleration factors.

title: Breaking Point Identification
question_ar: For the chain الغفلة→الكبر→الكفر, identify which link is most "breakable" based on: (a) number of counter-behaviors mentioned in Quran, (b) frequency of intervention guidance in tafsir.
question_en: For the chain الغفلة→الكبر→الكفر, identify which link is most "breakable" based on: (a) number of counter-behaviors mentioned in Quran, (b) frequency of intervention guidance in tafsir.

title: Causal Density Analysis
question_ar: Which behavior has the highest "causal density" (most outgoing CAUSES edges)? Which has highest "effect density" (most incoming CAUSES edges)? What does this reveal about Quranic behavioral architecture?
question_en: Which behavior has the highest "causal density" (most outgoing CAUSES edges)? Which has highest "effect density" (most incoming CAUSES edges)? What does this reveal about Quranic behavioral architecture?

title: Indirect Causation Detection
question_ar: Find behaviors that NEVER directly connect but always appear in causal chains together (A causes X causes B, but A never directly causes B). What mediating behaviors are essential?
question_en: Find behaviors that NEVER directly connect but always appear in causal chains together (A causes X causes B, but A never directly causes B). What mediating behaviors are essential?

title: Causal Reversibility
question_ar: For each causal pair (A CAUSES B), determine if the reverse is ever true (B CAUSES A). List all bidirectional causal relationships and their theological implications.
question_en: For each causal pair (A CAUSES B), determine if the reverse is ever true (B CAUSES A). List all bidirectional causal relationships and their theological implications.

title: The Tawbah Interrupt
question_ar: At which points in the chain غفلة→قسوة القلب→كبر→كفر can التوبة intervene? Show tafsir evidence for each intervention point.
question_en: At which points in the chain غفلة→قسوة القلب→كبر→كفر can التوبة intervene? Show tafsir evidence for each intervention point.

title: Multi-Source Causal Validation
question_ar: For the causal claim "الكبر يؤدي إلى الكفر", show agreement/disagreement across all 5 tafsir sources. Calculate consensus percentage.
question_en: For the causal claim "الكبر يؤدي إلى الكفر", show agreement/disagreement across all 5 tafsir sources. Calculate consensus percentage.

title: Causal Strength Quantification
question_ar: Rank all CAUSES relationships by strength, where strength = (number of verses supporting) × (number of tafsir sources agreeing). Top 10 strongest causal claims.
question_en: Rank all CAUSES relationships by strength, where strength = (number of verses supporting) × (number of tafsir sources agreeing). Top 10 strongest causal claims.

title: Hidden Causal Mediators
question_ar: Identify behaviors that are never endpoints but appear in >50% of causal chains. These are "hidden mediators." What role do they play?
question_en: Identify behaviors that are never endpoints but appear in >50% of causal chains. These are "hidden mediators." What role do they play?

title: Causal Chain Length Distribution
question_ar: What is the distribution of causal chain lengths in the Quranic behavioral graph? What is the longest documented chain with full verse evidence?
question_en: What is the distribution of causal chain lengths in the Quranic behavioral graph? What is the longest documented chain with full verse evidence?

title: Parallel Causation
question_ar: Find cases where two different behaviors cause the same outcome through completely independent paths. What does this redundancy reveal?
question_en: Find cases where two different behaviors cause the same outcome through completely independent paths. What does this redundancy reveal?

title: Causal Bottlenecks
question_ar: Identify "bottleneck behaviors" - behaviors that appear in >80% of all causal chains leading to الخسران. Removing these would block most paths to ruin.
question_en: Identify "bottleneck behaviors" - behaviors that appear in >80% of all causal chains leading to الخسران. Removing these would block most paths to ruin.

title: Temporal Causation Order
question_ar: For behaviors with temporal markers (دنيا/آخرة), verify that causal chains respect temporal order. Flag any chains where آخرة behaviors cause دنيا behaviors.
question_en: For behaviors with temporal markers (دنيا/آخرة), verify that causal chains respect temporal order. Flag any chains where آخرة behaviors cause دنيا behaviors.

title: The Iman Strengthening Network
question_ar: Map all behaviors that directly or indirectly strengthen الإيمان. Create a complete "Iman Strengthening Subgraph" with weights based on verse frequency.
question_en: Map all behaviors that directly or indirectly strengthen الإيمان. Create a complete "Iman Strengthening Subgraph" with weights based on verse frequency.

title: Causal Distance Matrix
question_ar: Create a 73×73 matrix showing causal distance (minimum hops) between all behavior pairs. Which pairs are maximally distant?
question_en: Create a 73×73 matrix showing causal distance (minimum hops) between all behavior pairs. Which pairs are maximally distant?

title: Causal Isolation
question_ar: Identify any behaviors that have NO causal connections (neither causing nor caused). Are they truly isolated or is this a data gap?
question_en: Identify any behaviors that have NO causal connections (neither causing nor caused). Are they truly isolated or is this a data gap?

title: Bidirectional Destruction
question_ar: Find behavior pairs where A causes B AND B causes A, creating mutual reinforcement. These are "lock-in" patterns - once entered, hard to escape.
question_en: Find behavior pairs where A causes B AND B causes A, creating mutual reinforcement. These are "lock-in" patterns - once entered, hard to escape.

title: Causal Hierarchy
question_ar: Build a hierarchical DAG of behaviors where higher levels cause lower levels. What are the "root cause" behaviors at the top?
question_en: Build a hierarchical DAG of behaviors where higher levels cause lower levels. What are the "root cause" behaviors at the top?

title: Intervention Point Ranking
question_ar: Rank all behaviors by "intervention leverage" - how many downstream negative outcomes are prevented by addressing this behavior first.
question_en: Rank all behaviors by "intervention leverage" - how many downstream negative outcomes are prevented by addressing this behavior first.

title: The Kibr Cascade
question_ar: Trace ALL downstream effects of الكبر to a depth of 5 hops. How many distinct behaviors are eventually affected?
question_en: Trace ALL downstream effects of الكبر to a depth of 5 hops. How many distinct behaviors are eventually affected?

title: Cross-Category Causation
question_ar: Analyze causal links that cross behavioral categories (e.g., cognitive→emotional→physical). What patterns emerge in cross-category causation?
question_en: Analyze causal links that cross behavioral categories (e.g., cognitive→emotional→physical). What patterns emerge in cross-category causation?

title: Causal Completeness Audit
question_ar: For each CAUSES edge in the graph, verify that at least one verse AND one tafsir source supports it. What percentage of edges have complete provenance?
question_en: For each CAUSES edge in the graph, verify that at least one verse AND one tafsir source supports it. What percentage of edges have complete provenance?

title: Methodological Fingerprinting
question_ar: For each of the 5 tafsir sources, identify their top 5 most frequently mentioned behaviors. Do these fingerprints align with known methodological emphases?
question_en: For each of the 5 tafsir sources, identify their top 5 most frequently mentioned behaviors. Do these fingerprints align with known methodological emphases?

title: The Riba Divergence
question_ar: Compare all 5 tafsir interpretations of الربا across every verse where it appears. Create a divergence matrix showing where they agree and disagree.
question_en: Compare all 5 tafsir interpretations of الربا across every verse where it appears. Create a divergence matrix showing where they agree and disagree.

title: Narrative vs Legal Focus
question_ar: Quantify the ratio of narrative content (قصص) to legal content (أحكام) in each tafsir source when explaining the same verses. How does this affect behavioral extraction?
question_en: Quantify the ratio of narrative content (قصص) to legal content (أحكام) in each tafsir source when explaining the same verses. How does this affect behavioral extraction?

title: Linguistic Analysis Depth
question_ar: For verses with behavioral keywords, compare how deeply each mufassir analyzes the Arabic morphology. Rank sources by linguistic analysis depth.
question_en: For verses with behavioral keywords, compare how deeply each mufassir analyzes the Arabic morphology. Rank sources by linguistic analysis depth.

title: Historical Context Variance
question_ar: When providing سبب النزول for behavioral verses, how much do the 5 sources differ? Create a historical context agreement matrix.
question_en: When providing سبب النزول for behavioral verses, how much do the 5 sources differ? Create a historical context agreement matrix.

title: Chain of Narration Analysis
question_ar: For Ibn Kathir and Tabari (narration-heavy sources), compare how often they cite the same إسناد for behavioral interpretations.
question_en: For Ibn Kathir and Tabari (narration-heavy sources), compare how often they cite the same إسناد for behavioral interpretations.

title: Scholarly Citation Mapping
question_ar: Map which earlier scholars each mufassir cites most frequently when explaining behaviors. Create a citation influence network.
question_en: Map which earlier scholars each mufassir cites most frequently when explaining behaviors. Create a citation influence network.

title: The Sabr Interpretation Spectrum
question_ar: Collect all interpretations of الصبر from all 5 sources. Create a semantic spectrum from most literal to most metaphorical interpretations.
question_en: Collect all interpretations of الصبر from all 5 sources. Create a semantic spectrum from most literal to most metaphorical interpretations.

title: Jalalayn Expansion Factor
question_ar: For each Jalalayn entry, measure how much Ibn Kathir and Tabari expand on the same verse. Calculate average expansion factor per behavior.
question_en: For each Jalalayn entry, measure how much Ibn Kathir and Tabari expand on the same verse. Calculate average expansion factor per behavior.

title: Implicit vs Explicit Behaviors
question_ar: Which tafsir source most frequently infers implicit behaviors not explicitly stated in verses? Quantify implicit behavior extraction by source.
question_en: Which tafsir source most frequently infers implicit behaviors not explicitly stated in verses? Quantify implicit behavior extraction by source.

title: Disputed Behaviors
question_ar: Identify behaviors where at least 2 tafsir sources have contradictory interpretations. List all disputes with evidence.
question_en: Identify behaviors where at least 2 tafsir sources have contradictory interpretations. List all disputes with evidence.

title: Unique Source Insights
question_ar: For each tafsir source, identify behavioral insights that appear ONLY in that source and nowhere else. These are unique scholarly contributions.
question_en: For each tafsir source, identify behavioral insights that appear ONLY in that source and nowhere else. These are unique scholarly contributions.

title: Qurtubi Legal Behaviors
question_ar: Extract all behaviors that Qurtubi connects to specific legal rulings (أحكام). Create a behavior→ruling mapping.
question_en: Extract all behaviors that Qurtubi connects to specific legal rulings (أحكام). Create a behavior→ruling mapping.

title: Sa'di Spiritual Emphasis
question_ar: Quantify how often Sa'di interprets behaviors in spiritual/تزكية terms versus literal terms. Compare with other sources.
question_en: Quantify how often Sa'di interprets behaviors in spiritual/تزكية terms versus literal terms. Compare with other sources.

title: Cross-Source Behavioral Frequency
question_ar: For each of the 73 behaviors, count mentions across all 5 sources. Which behaviors are universally emphasized? Which are source-specific?
question_en: For each of the 73 behaviors, count mentions across all 5 sources. Which behaviors are universally emphasized? Which are source-specific?

title: Tafsir Temporal Evolution
question_ar: Comparing classical (Tabari) to later (Sa'di) sources, have behavioral interpretations evolved? Identify any semantic drift over centuries.
question_en: Comparing classical (Tabari) to later (Sa'di) sources, have behavioral interpretations evolved? Identify any semantic drift over centuries.

title: The Nifaq Analysis
question_ar: Collect all descriptions of النفاق behaviors from all 5 sources. Create a unified "munafiq behavioral profile" with source attribution.
question_en: Collect all descriptions of النفاق behaviors from all 5 sources. Create a unified "munafiq behavioral profile" with source attribution.

title: Agent Identification Variance
question_ar: When verses have implicit agents, how often do the 5 sources agree on agent identification? Measure agent attribution consensus.
question_en: When verses have implicit agents, how often do the 5 sources agree on agent identification? Measure agent attribution consensus.

title: Consequence Attribution
question_ar: For behaviors with worldly/hereafter consequences, compare how each source describes the consequences. Create a consequence severity matrix by source.
question_en: For behaviors with worldly/hereafter consequences, compare how each source describes the consequences. Create a consequence severity matrix by source.

title: Behavioral Clustering by Source
question_ar: Apply clustering to each source's behavioral mentions independently. Do different sources produce different behavioral clusters?
question_en: Apply clustering to each source's behavioral mentions independently. Do different sources produce different behavioral clusters?

title: The Comprehensive Verse Test
question_ar: For verse 2:177 (the comprehensive righteousness verse), extract and compare all behavioral components identified by each source.
question_en: For verse 2:177 (the comprehensive righteousness verse), extract and compare all behavioral components identified by each source.

title: Source-Specific Vocabulary
question_ar: Identify Arabic terms that appear frequently in one tafsir source but rarely in others. What does this reveal about methodological vocabulary?
question_en: Identify Arabic terms that appear frequently in one tafsir source but rarely in others. What does this reveal about methodological vocabulary?

title: Interpretive Confidence
question_ar: Some mufassirin express uncertainty (قيل، يحتمل). Quantify interpretive confidence by source when explaining behaviors.
question_en: Some mufassirin express uncertainty (قيل، يحتمل). Quantify interpretive confidence by source when explaining behaviors.

title: Cross-Reference Density
question_ar: How often does each source cross-reference other Quranic verses when explaining behaviors? Rank by intertextual density.
question_en: How often does each source cross-reference other Quranic verses when explaining behaviors? Rank by intertextual density.

title: The Complete Behavioral Extraction Audit
question_ar: For each of the 6,236 verses, verify that at least one behavior can be extracted from at least one tafsir source. What is the coverage rate?
question_en: For each of the 6,236 verses, verify that at least one behavior can be extracted from at least one tafsir source. What is the coverage rate?

title: Complete Hasad Profile
question_ar: Generate the full 11-dimensional profile for الحسد: organic, situational, systemic, spatial, temporal, agent, source, evaluation, heart-type, consequence, and related behaviors.
question_en: Generate the full 11-dimensional profile for الحسد: organic, situational, systemic, spatial, temporal, agent, source, evaluation, heart-type, consequence, and related behaviors.

title: Organic Axis Dominance
question_ar: Which axis of the 11 dimensions has the most data coverage across all behaviors? Which is most sparse? Quantify per axis.
question_en: Which axis of the 11 dimensions has the most data coverage across all behaviors? Which is most sparse? Quantify per axis.

title: Cross-Axis Correlations
question_ar: Identify correlations between axes. For example, do behaviors with "قلب" organic context tend to have specific systemic contexts?
question_en: Identify correlations between axes. For example, do behaviors with "قلب" organic context tend to have specific systemic contexts?

title: Profile Similarity Search
question_ar: Given the profile of الصبر, find the 3 behaviors with most similar 11-dimensional profiles. Are they semantically related?
question_en: Given the profile of الصبر, find the 3 behaviors with most similar 11-dimensional profiles. Are they semantically related?

title: Dimensional Outliers
question_ar: Identify behaviors whose profiles are outliers - they don't fit common dimensional patterns. What makes them unique?
question_en: Identify behaviors whose profiles are outliers - they don't fit common dimensional patterns. What makes them unique?

title: The Complete 73 Profiles
question_ar: Generate 11-dimensional profiles for all 73 behaviors. Identify any behaviors with incomplete axis coverage.
question_en: Generate 11-dimensional profiles for all 73 behaviors. Identify any behaviors with incomplete axis coverage.

title: Profile-Based Clustering
question_ar: Cluster all 73 behaviors based on their 11-dimensional profiles. How does this clustering compare to the traditional category taxonomy?
question_en: Cluster all 73 behaviors based on their 11-dimensional profiles. How does this clustering compare to the traditional category taxonomy?

title: Axis Independence Test
question_ar: Test whether the 11 axes are truly independent or if some are redundant (highly correlated). Report on dimensional independence.
question_en: Test whether the 11 axes are truly independent or if some are redundant (highly correlated). Report on dimensional independence.

title: Profile Prediction
question_ar: Given 10 of 11 dimensions for an unknown behavior, can the system predict the 11th? Test predictive accuracy across all axes.
question_en: Given 10 of 11 dimensions for an unknown behavior, can the system predict the 11th? Test predictive accuracy across all axes.

title: Situational Distribution
question_ar: What is the distribution of behaviors across internal (داخلي) vs external (خارجي) situational contexts? Which categories skew which way?
question_en: What is the distribution of behaviors across internal (داخلي) vs external (خارجي) situational contexts? Which categories skew which way?

title: Systemic Domain Mapping
question_ar: Map all behaviors to their systemic domains (SYS_GOD, SYS_SELF, SYS_SOCIAL, SYS_WORLD). Which domain has most behaviors?
question_en: Map all behaviors to their systemic domains (SYS_GOD, SYS_SELF, SYS_SOCIAL, SYS_WORLD). Which domain has most behaviors?

title: Temporal Context Analysis
question_ar: Categorize all behaviors by temporal relevance: دنيا only, آخرة only, both, neither. What patterns emerge?
question_en: Categorize all behaviors by temporal relevance: دنيا only, آخرة only, both, neither. What patterns emerge?

title: Spatial Context Mapping
question_ar: Identify behaviors with specific spatial contexts (مسجد، بيت، سوق). Create a location-behavior heat map.
question_en: Identify behaviors with specific spatial contexts (مسجد، بيت، سوق). Create a location-behavior heat map.

title: Agent-Behavior Matrix
question_ar: Create complete matrix of which agent types perform which behaviors. Are certain behaviors exclusive to certain agents?
question_en: Create complete matrix of which agent types perform which behaviors. Are certain behaviors exclusive to certain agents?

title: Behavioral Sources
question_ar: For each behavior, identify its source category (divine command, prophetic example, human inclination, shaytan influence). Map the source distribution.
question_en: For each behavior, identify its source category (divine command, prophetic example, human inclination, shaytan influence). Map the source distribution.

title: Evaluation Distribution
question_ar: What is the ratio of positive (محمود) to negative (مذموم) to neutral behaviors in the taxonomy? By category?
question_en: What is the ratio of positive (محمود) to negative (مذموم) to neutral behaviors in the taxonomy? By category?

title: Heart-Type Correlations
question_ar: Map which heart states correlate with which behaviors. Do certain behaviors require certain heart conditions?
question_en: Map which heart states correlate with which behaviors. Do certain behaviors require certain heart conditions?

title: Consequence Severity Ranking
question_ar: Rank all behaviors by consequence severity (no consequence → worldly harm → hereafter punishment → eternal punishment).
question_en: Rank all behaviors by consequence severity (no consequence → worldly harm → hereafter punishment → eternal punishment).

title: Multi-Agent Behaviors
question_ar: Identify behaviors that involve multiple agent types (e.g., speaker and listener). Create a multi-agent interaction map.
question_en: Identify behaviors that involve multiple agent types (e.g., speaker and listener). Create a multi-agent interaction map.

title: Dimensional Completeness Score
question_ar: For each of 73 behaviors, calculate a "completeness score" (dimensions with data / 11). Average completeness across taxonomy.
question_en: For each of 73 behaviors, calculate a "completeness score" (dimensions with data / 11). Average completeness across taxonomy.

title: Profile Evolution by Surah
question_ar: Do behavioral profiles differ between Makki and Madani surahs? Compare profile distributions by revelation period.
question_en: Do behavioral profiles differ between Makki and Madani surahs? Compare profile distributions by revelation period.

title: Dimensional Hierarchy
question_ar: Is there a natural hierarchy among the 11 dimensions? (Some more fundamental than others?) Use frequency and dependency analysis.
question_en: Is there a natural hierarchy among the 11 dimensions? (Some more fundamental than others?) Use frequency and dependency analysis.

title: Profile Anomaly Detection
question_ar: Identify behaviors whose profiles are self-contradictory (e.g., negative evaluation but positive consequence). Flag for review.
question_en: Identify behaviors whose profiles are self-contradictory (e.g., negative evaluation but positive consequence). Flag for review.

title: Cross-Cultural Profile Comparison
question_ar: Compare the 11-dimensional profile of "patience" in QBM vs how it might be categorized in secular behavioral psychology.
question_en: Compare the 11-dimensional profile of "patience" in QBM vs how it might be categorized in secular behavioral psychology.

title: The Ultimate Profile Query
question_ar: Given a natural language description of a behavior, generate its complete 11-dimensional profile without being told which behavior it is.
question_en: Given a natural language description of a behavior, generate its complete 11-dimensional profile without being told which behavior it is.

title: Global Network Statistics
question_ar: Report: node count, edge count, density, average degree, diameter, average clustering coefficient for the complete behavioral graph.
question_en: Report: node count, edge count, density, average degree, diameter, average clustering coefficient for the complete behavioral graph.

title: Centrality Ranking (Degree)
question_ar: Rank all 73 behaviors by degree centrality (total connections). What characterizes high-degree behaviors?
question_en: Rank all 73 behaviors by degree centrality (total connections). What characterizes high-degree behaviors?

title: Centrality Ranking (Betweenness)
question_ar: Rank all behaviors by betweenness centrality (bridge importance). Which behaviors control information flow?
question_en: Rank all behaviors by betweenness centrality (bridge importance). Which behaviors control information flow?

title: Centrality Ranking (Eigenvector)
question_ar: Rank by eigenvector centrality (connected to important nodes). Which behaviors have influential neighbors?
question_en: Rank by eigenvector centrality (connected to important nodes). Which behaviors have influential neighbors?

title: Centrality Ranking (PageRank)
question_ar: Apply PageRank to behavioral graph. Which behaviors would be "most visited" in a random walk through behaviors?
question_en: Apply PageRank to behavioral graph. Which behaviors would be "most visited" in a random walk through behaviors?

title: Centrality Comparison
question_ar: Do the 4 centrality measures agree on top behaviors? Create Venn diagram of top-10 by each measure.
question_en: Do the 4 centrality measures agree on top behaviors? Create Venn diagram of top-10 by each measure.

title: Community Detection
question_ar: Apply Louvain community detection to identify natural behavioral clusters. Name and characterize each community.
question_en: Apply Louvain community detection to identify natural behavioral clusters. Name and characterize each community.

title: Community Stability
question_ar: Run community detection with different parameters. Are the same communities consistently detected? Measure stability.
question_en: Run community detection with different parameters. Are the same communities consistently detected? Measure stability.

title: Inter-Community Bridges
question_ar: Identify edges that connect different communities. These are inter-community bridges. What types of relationships are they?
question_en: Identify edges that connect different communities. These are inter-community bridges. What types of relationships are they?

title: Community-Relationship Patterns
question_ar: Do certain relationship types (CAUSES, OPPOSITE) tend to be intra-community or inter-community? Analyze pattern.
question_en: Do certain relationship types (CAUSES, OPPOSITE) tend to be intra-community or inter-community? Analyze pattern.

title: Assortativity Analysis
question_ar: Is the network assortative (similar nodes connect) or disassortative? By which node properties?
question_en: Is the network assortative (similar nodes connect) or disassortative? By which node properties?

title: Core-Periphery Structure
question_ar: Identify the "core" behaviors (highly interconnected) vs "periphery" (loosely connected). What characterizes each?
question_en: Identify the "core" behaviors (highly interconnected) vs "periphery" (loosely connected). What characterizes each?

title: Small World Test
question_ar: Does the behavioral network exhibit small-world properties (high clustering, short paths)? Compare to random graph.
question_en: Does the behavioral network exhibit small-world properties (high clustering, short paths)? Compare to random graph.

title: Scale-Free Test
question_ar: Does the degree distribution follow power law (scale-free)? Are there "hub" behaviors?
question_en: Does the degree distribution follow power law (scale-free)? Are there "hub" behaviors?

title: Robustness Analysis
question_ar: How many nodes must be removed to disconnect the graph? Which nodes, if removed, cause maximum damage?
question_en: How many nodes must be removed to disconnect the graph? Which nodes, if removed, cause maximum damage?

title: Shortest Path Distribution
question_ar: What is the distribution of shortest path lengths between all behavior pairs? Average path length?
question_en: What is the distribution of shortest path lengths between all behavior pairs? Average path length?

title: Triangles and Transitivity
question_ar: Count all triangles in the graph. Is the network highly transitive (if A→B and B→C, then A→C)?
question_en: Count all triangles in the graph. Is the network highly transitive (if A→B and B→C, then A→C)?

title: Reciprocity Analysis
question_ar: For directed edges, what percentage are reciprocated (A→B and B→A)? By relationship type?
question_en: For directed edges, what percentage are reciprocated (A→B and B→A)? By relationship type?

title: Isolated Components
question_ar: Are there any disconnected components in the graph? If so, what behaviors are isolated from the main component?
question_en: Are there any disconnected components in the graph? If so, what behaviors are isolated from the main component?

title: Temporal Network Growth
question_ar: If we add behaviors in revelation order, how does network topology evolve? Makki structure vs Madani structure.
question_en: If we add behaviors in revelation order, how does network topology evolve? Makki structure vs Madani structure.

title: Minimum Spanning Tree
question_ar: Compute the MST of the behavioral network. This shows the essential skeleton of relationships.
question_en: Compute the MST of the behavioral network. This shows the essential skeleton of relationships.

title: Clique Detection
question_ar: Find all maximal cliques (fully connected subgroups). What behaviors form tight clusters?
question_en: Find all maximal cliques (fully connected subgroups). What behaviors form tight clusters?

title: K-Core Decomposition
question_ar: Apply k-core decomposition. What is the maximum k? Which behaviors are in the innermost core?
question_en: Apply k-core decomposition. What is the maximum k? Which behaviors are in the innermost core?

title: Network Motif Analysis
question_ar: Identify recurring small patterns (motifs) in the network. Are certain 3-node or 4-node patterns overrepresented?
question_en: Identify recurring small patterns (motifs) in the network. Are certain 3-node or 4-node patterns overrepresented?

title: Predictive Link Analysis
question_ar: Based on network structure, predict which behavior pairs should be connected but aren't. These are potential missing edges.
question_en: Based on network structure, predict which behavior pairs should be connected but aren't. These are potential missing edges.

title: Complete Heart State Inventory
question_ar: List all heart states mentioned in Quran with their behavioral correlates: قلب سليم، قلب قاسٍ، قلب مريض، قلب ميت، قلب مطمئن، etc.
question_en: List all heart states mentioned in Quran with their behavioral correlates: قلب سليم، قلب قاسٍ، قلب مريض، قلب ميت، قلب مطمئن، etc.

title: Heart State Transition Graph
question_ar: Create a directed graph showing possible transitions between heart states. Which transitions are mentioned in Quran?
question_en: Create a directed graph showing possible transitions between heart states. Which transitions are mentioned in Quran?

title: Behavioral Causes of Heart States
question_ar: For each heart state, list behaviors that cause that state to develop. Create heart_state←behaviors mapping.
question_en: For each heart state, list behaviors that cause that state to develop. Create heart_state←behaviors mapping.

title: Behavioral Symptoms of Heart States
question_ar: For each heart state, list behaviors that manifest from that state. Create heart_state→behaviors mapping.
question_en: For each heart state, list behaviors that manifest from that state. Create heart_state→behaviors mapping.

title: Heart State Detection
question_ar: Given a set of behaviors exhibited by a person, infer their most likely heart state based on Quranic mapping.
question_en: Given a set of behaviors exhibited by a person, infer their most likely heart state based on Quranic mapping.

title: Heart Purification Pathway
question_ar: Map the complete behavioral pathway from قلب قاسٍ to قلب سليم with all intermediate states and required behaviors.
question_en: Map the complete behavioral pathway from قلب قاسٍ to قلب سليم with all intermediate states and required behaviors.

title: Heart Corruption Pathway
question_ar: Map the complete behavioral pathway from قلب سليم to قلب قاسٍ/ميت with all intermediate states and corrupting behaviors.
question_en: Map the complete behavioral pathway from قلب سليم to قلب قاسٍ/ميت with all intermediate states and corrupting behaviors.

title: Heart State Stability
question_ar: Which heart states are "stable" (hard to leave) vs "unstable" (easily changed)? Base analysis on number of exit transitions.
question_en: Which heart states are "stable" (hard to leave) vs "unstable" (easily changed)? Base analysis on number of exit transitions.

title: Heart-Behavior Bidirectional Analysis
question_ar: Identify behaviors that both cause and result from the same heart state (reinforcement loops). These are stability factors.
question_en: Identify behaviors that both cause and result from the same heart state (reinforcement loops). These are stability factors.

title: The Munafiq Heart
question_ar: What is the unique behavioral signature of قلب المنافق? Which behaviors are exclusive to this state?
question_en: What is the unique behavioral signature of قلب المنافق? Which behaviors are exclusive to this state?

title: Heart State Distribution
question_ar: Across all verses mentioning heart states, what is the frequency distribution? Which states are most discussed?
question_en: Across all verses mentioning heart states, what is the frequency distribution? Which states are most discussed?

title: Heart State Quantification
question_ar: Can heart states be arranged on a continuous scale (e.g., spiritual health 0-100)? Propose and validate a quantification.
question_en: Can heart states be arranged on a continuous scale (e.g., spiritual health 0-100)? Propose and validate a quantification.

title: Cross-Tafsir Heart Analysis
question_ar: Compare how different mufassirin describe heart states. Do they agree on characteristics and transitions?
question_en: Compare how different mufassirin describe heart states. Do they agree on characteristics and transitions?

title: Heart and Organ Interaction
question_ar: How do other organs (عين، لسان، أذن) interact with heart states? Map organ→heart and heart→organ relationships.
question_en: How do other organs (عين، لسان، أذن) interact with heart states? Map organ→heart and heart→organ relationships.

title: Heart State Inheritance
question_ar: Do heart states have hierarchical relationships (e.g., قلب مطمئن is a subtype of قلب سليم)?
question_en: Do heart states have hierarchical relationships (e.g., قلب مطمئن is a subtype of قلب سليم)?

title: Heart State Temporal Dynamics
question_ar: Can heart states change instantly or do they require gradual transition? What does Quran say about transition speed?
question_en: Can heart states change instantly or do they require gradual transition? What does Quran say about transition speed?

title: Heart State and Agent Type
question_ar: Do different agent types (مؤمن، كافر، منافق) have characteristic heart states? Map agent→heart state.
question_en: Do different agent types (مؤمن، كافر، منافق) have characteristic heart states? Map agent→heart state.

title: Heart State Reversibility
question_ar: Which heart state transitions are reversible? Is قلب ميت→قلب سليم ever possible according to Quran?
question_en: Which heart state transitions are reversible? Is قلب ميت→قلب سليم ever possible according to Quran?

title: The Perfect Heart
question_ar: What is the complete behavioral profile of someone with قلب سليم? List all expected present behaviors and absent behaviors.
question_en: What is the complete behavioral profile of someone with قلب سليم? List all expected present behaviors and absent behaviors.

title: Heart State Diagnostic Protocol
question_ar: Create a diagnostic questionnaire: given answers about behaviors, determine heart state using Quranic criteria.
question_en: Create a diagnostic questionnaire: given answers about behaviors, determine heart state using Quranic criteria.

title: Complete Agent Inventory
question_ar: List all agent types in QBM with their behavioral capabilities and constraints.
question_en: List all agent types in QBM with their behavioral capabilities and constraints.

title: Agent-Behavior Exclusivity
question_ar: Which behaviors are exclusive to certain agent types? (E.g., only الله has certain attributes)
question_en: Which behaviors are exclusive to certain agent types? (E.g., only الله has certain attributes)

title: Divine Attribute Mapping
question_ar: Map all divine صفات الأفعال mentioned in Quran. How are these distinct from human behaviors?
question_en: Map all divine صفات الأفعال mentioned in Quran. How are these distinct from human behaviors?

title: Prophetic Behavioral Standard
question_ar: Compile all behaviors explicitly attributed to prophets. This is the "prophetic behavioral ideal."
question_en: Compile all behaviors explicitly attributed to prophets. This is the "prophetic behavioral ideal."

title: Believer Behavioral Expectations
question_ar: What behaviors does Quran explicitly expect from مؤمنين? Complete behavioral expectation list.
question_en: What behaviors does Quran explicitly expect from مؤمنين? Complete behavioral expectation list.

title: Disbeliever Behavioral Patterns
question_ar: What behaviors does Quran associate with كافرين? Create complete pattern profile.
question_en: What behaviors does Quran associate with كافرين? Create complete pattern profile.

title: Munafiq Behavioral Signature
question_ar: What behaviors uniquely identify منافقين? These are behavioral "red flags" per Quran.
question_en: What behaviors uniquely identify منافقين? These are behavioral "red flags" per Quran.

title: Shaytan Behavioral Influence
question_ar: Map all behaviors attributed to شيطان influence. How does shaytan cause behaviors in humans?
question_en: Map all behaviors attributed to شيطان influence. How does shaytan cause behaviors in humans?

title: Angel Behavioral Nature
question_ar: What behaviors are attributed to ملائكة? How do they differ from human behavioral capabilities?
question_en: What behaviors are attributed to ملائكة? How do they differ from human behavioral capabilities?

title: Agent Interaction Patterns
question_ar: Map behavioral interactions between agent types (e.g., prophets guiding believers, shaytan tempting humans).
question_en: Map behavioral interactions between agent types (e.g., prophets guiding believers, shaytan tempting humans).

title: Agent Hierarchy
question_ar: Is there an implicit agent hierarchy in Quranic behavioral expectations? (Higher expectations for some agents?)
question_en: Is there an implicit agent hierarchy in Quranic behavioral expectations? (Higher expectations for some agents?)

title: Agent Transformation
question_ar: Can agents change types through behavior? (E.g., مؤمن→منافق through certain behaviors)
question_en: Can agents change types through behavior? (E.g., مؤمن→منافق through certain behaviors)

title: Collective Agent Behaviors
question_ar: Identify behaviors attributed to collective agents (قوم، أمة، ناس) vs individual agents.
question_en: Identify behaviors attributed to collective agents (قوم، أمة، ناس) vs individual agents.

title: Historical Agent Comparison
question_ar: Compare behavioral patterns of historical agents (فرعون، قارون) with general كافرين patterns.
question_en: Compare behavioral patterns of historical agents (فرعون، قارون) with general كافرين patterns.

title: Agent Responsibility Levels
question_ar: Map behaviors to required agent capabilities (عقل، بلوغ). Which behaviors require full accountability?
question_en: Map behaviors to required agent capabilities (عقل، بلوغ). Which behaviors require full accountability?

title: Agent-Consequence Mapping
question_ar: Do consequences differ by agent type for the same behavior? (Stricter for عالم than جاهل?)
question_en: Do consequences differ by agent type for the same behavior? (Stricter for عالم than جاهل?)

title: Gender and Agent Behaviors
question_ar: Are any behaviors specifically attributed to male or female agents in Quran? Map gender-specific guidance.
question_en: Are any behaviors specifically attributed to male or female agents in Quran? Map gender-specific guidance.

title: Age and Agent Behaviors
question_ar: Are any behaviors specific to certain life stages (child, adult, elderly)? Map age-relevant behaviors.
question_en: Are any behaviors specific to certain life stages (child, adult, elderly)? Map age-relevant behaviors.

title: Social Role Behaviors
question_ar: Map behaviors to social roles (والدين، أولاد، زوج، جار). Role-specific behavioral expectations.
question_en: Map behaviors to social roles (والدين، أولاد، زوج، جار). Role-specific behavioral expectations.

title: The Complete Agent-Behavior Matrix
question_ar: Create full 73×N matrix (behaviors × agent types) showing which agents perform which behaviors.
question_en: Create full 73×N matrix (behaviors × agent types) showing which agents perform which behaviors.

title: Dunya Behavioral Catalog
question_ar: List all behaviors specifically relevant to worldly life (الدنيا) with verse evidence.
question_en: List all behaviors specifically relevant to worldly life (الدنيا) with verse evidence.

title: Akhira Behavioral Catalog
question_ar: List all behaviors specifically relevant to hereafter (الآخرة) with verse evidence.
question_en: List all behaviors specifically relevant to hereafter (الآخرة) with verse evidence.

title: Temporal Bridge Behaviors
question_ar: Identify behaviors that span both دنيا and آخرة, connecting worldly actions to eternal consequences.
question_en: Identify behaviors that span both دنيا and آخرة, connecting worldly actions to eternal consequences.

title: Behavioral Urgency Mapping
question_ar: Map behaviors by implied urgency: immediate action required vs gradual development vs lifetime journey.
question_en: Map behaviors by implied urgency: immediate action required vs gradual development vs lifetime journey.

title: Sacred Space Behaviors
question_ar: Which behaviors are specifically associated with المسجد الحرام، المسجد النبوي، المسجد الأقصى?
question_en: Which behaviors are specifically associated with المسجد الحرام، المسجد النبوي، المسجد الأقصى?

title: Home Behaviors
question_ar: Which behaviors are specifically guided for البيت/المنزل context?
question_en: Which behaviors are specifically guided for البيت/المنزل context?

title: Marketplace Behaviors
question_ar: Which behaviors are relevant to السوق/التجارة context?
question_en: Which behaviors are relevant to السوق/التجارة context?

title: Travel Behaviors
question_ar: Which behaviors are mentioned in السفر context?
question_en: Which behaviors are mentioned in السفر context?

title: War/Conflict Behaviors
question_ar: Which behaviors are specifically for الجهاد/القتال context?
question_en: Which behaviors are specifically for الجهاد/القتال context?

title: Context-Sensitive Behavioral Rules
question_ar: Identify behaviors whose ruling changes based on context (حضر vs سفر, سلم vs حرب).
question_en: Identify behaviors whose ruling changes based on context (حضر vs سفر, سلم vs حرب).

title: Temporal Sequence Requirements
question_ar: Which behaviors must follow specific sequences? (E.g., توبة before عبادة is accepted?)
question_en: Which behaviors must follow specific sequences? (E.g., توبة before عبادة is accepted?)

title: Spatial Sanctity Gradient
question_ar: Map behaviors by spatial sanctity level: الحرم → المسجد → البيت → العام.
question_en: Map behaviors by spatial sanctity level: الحرم → المسجد → البيت → العام.

title: Day/Night Behavioral Guidance
question_ar: Are any behaviors specifically for ليل vs نهار? Map time-of-day behavioral guidance.
question_en: Are any behaviors specifically for ليل vs نهار? Map time-of-day behavioral guidance.

title: Seasonal Behavioral Patterns
question_ar: Are any behaviors connected to specific times (رمضان، حج، etc.)? Map temporal patterns.
question_en: Are any behaviors connected to specific times (رمضان، حج، etc.)? Map temporal patterns.

title: The Universal Behaviors
question_ar: Which behaviors apply in ALL temporal and spatial contexts without exception?
question_en: Which behaviors apply in ALL temporal and spatial contexts without exception?

title: Complete Consequence Inventory
question_ar: List all consequence types mentioned in Quran for behaviors: worldly, barzakh, hereafter, eternal.
question_en: List all consequence types mentioned in Quran for behaviors: worldly, barzakh, hereafter, eternal.

title: Positive Consequence Catalog
question_ar: For all positive behaviors, map their promised rewards with verse evidence.
question_en: For all positive behaviors, map their promised rewards with verse evidence.

title: Negative Consequence Catalog
question_ar: For all negative behaviors, map their threatened punishments with verse evidence.
question_en: For all negative behaviors, map their threatened punishments with verse evidence.

title: Consequence Severity Scale
question_ar: Create a quantitative scale of consequence severity. Rank all consequences from mildest to most severe.
question_en: Create a quantitative scale of consequence severity. Rank all consequences from mildest to most severe.

title: Behavior-Consequence Proportionality
question_ar: Analyze proportionality: do more severe behaviors receive more severe consequences?
question_en: Analyze proportionality: do more severe behaviors receive more severe consequences?

title: Collective Consequences
question_ar: Which behaviors have collective (قومي/أممي) consequences vs individual consequences?
question_en: Which behaviors have collective (قومي/أممي) consequences vs individual consequences?

title: Immediate vs Delayed Consequences
question_ar: Map behaviors by consequence timing: immediate (فوري) vs delayed (آجل).
question_en: Map behaviors by consequence timing: immediate (فوري) vs delayed (آجل).

title: Visible vs Hidden Consequences
question_ar: Which consequences are visible in دنيا vs hidden until آخرة?
question_en: Which consequences are visible in دنيا vs hidden until آخرة?

title: Consequence Reversibility
question_ar: Which negative consequences can be reversed through توبة? Which are irreversible?
question_en: Which negative consequences can be reversed through توبة? Which are irreversible?

title: Reward Multipliers
question_ar: Which behaviors have multiplied rewards (حسنة بعشر أمثالها)? Map multiplication factors.
question_en: Which behaviors have multiplied rewards (حسنة بعشر أمثالها)? Map multiplication factors.

title: Punishment Multipliers
question_ar: Are any punishments multiplied based on context (عالم vs جاهل, مكة vs elsewhere)?
question_en: Are any punishments multiplied based on context (عالم vs جاهل, مكة vs elsewhere)?

title: Compound Consequences
question_ar: Which behavior combinations produce compound consequences (worse or better than sum of parts)?
question_en: Which behavior combinations produce compound consequences (worse or better than sum of parts)?

title: Consequence Inheritance
question_ar: Do behavioral consequences affect descendants (الذرية)? Map inherited consequences.
question_en: Do behavioral consequences affect descendants (الذرية)? Map inherited consequences.

title: Intercession and Consequences
question_ar: For which behavioral consequences is intercession (شفاعة) possible? Which exclude intercession?
question_en: For which behavioral consequences is intercession (شفاعة) possible? Which exclude intercession?

title: The Ultimate Consequence Map
question_ar: Create complete behavior→consequence mapping for all 73 behaviors with severity scores.
question_en: Create complete behavior→consequence mapping for all 73 behaviors with severity scores.

title: Behavior Embedding Visualization
question_ar: Create 2D t-SNE visualization of all 73 behaviors. Do semantic clusters match categorical taxonomy?
question_en: Create 2D t-SNE visualization of all 73 behaviors. Do semantic clusters match categorical taxonomy?

title: Nearest Neighbor Accuracy
question_ar: For each behavior, do its nearest embedding neighbors match its graph neighbors? Measure alignment.
question_en: For each behavior, do its nearest embedding neighbors match its graph neighbors? Measure alignment.

title: Opposite Behavior Distance
question_ar: Verify that opposite behaviors (الصبر↔الجزع) are far apart in embedding space. Measure opposite separation.
question_en: Verify that opposite behaviors (الصبر↔الجزع) are far apart in embedding space. Measure opposite separation.

title: Similar Behavior Proximity
question_ar: Verify that similar behaviors cluster together. Measure similar clustering quality.
question_en: Verify that similar behaviors cluster together. Measure similar clustering quality.

title: Category Coherence
question_ar: Do behaviors in the same category form coherent clusters? Measure per-category coherence.
question_en: Do behaviors in the same category form coherent clusters? Measure per-category coherence.

title: Embedding Outliers
question_ar: Which behaviors are embedding outliers (far from all others)? Are these legitimately unique or data issues?
question_en: Which behaviors are embedding outliers (far from all others)? Are these legitimately unique or data issues?

title: Semantic Drift Detection
question_ar: For behaviors used in multiple contexts, measure semantic variance. Which behaviors have most contextual drift?
question_en: For behaviors used in multiple contexts, measure semantic variance. Which behaviors have most contextual drift?

title: Cross-Language Consistency
question_ar: Do Arabic and English embeddings of the same behavior cluster together? Measure cross-language alignment.
question_en: Do Arabic and English embeddings of the same behavior cluster together? Measure cross-language alignment.

title: Embedding-Graph Alignment
question_ar: Measure overall alignment between embedding similarity and graph connectivity. Should be correlated.
question_en: Measure overall alignment between embedding similarity and graph connectivity. Should be correlated.

title: Behavioral Analogies
question_ar: Can the embedding space solve analogies? (الصبر:الجزع :: التواضع:?) Test analogy accuracy.
question_en: Can the embedding space solve analogies? (الصبر:الجزع :: التواضع:?) Test analogy accuracy.

title: Cluster-Relationship Correlation
question_ar: Do behaviors in the same embedding cluster tend to have specific relationship types?
question_en: Do behaviors in the same embedding cluster tend to have specific relationship types?

title: Embedding Dimensionality
question_ar: What is the effective dimensionality of the behavioral embedding space? Are 768 dimensions necessary?
question_en: What is the effective dimensionality of the behavioral embedding space? Are 768 dimensions necessary?

title: Stability Across Models
question_ar: Compare embeddings from different models (AraBERT, CAMeL). Do they agree on behavioral relationships?
question_en: Compare embeddings from different models (AraBERT, CAMeL). Do they agree on behavioral relationships?

title: Context Window Effects
question_ar: How does context window size affect behavioral embeddings extracted from tafsir?
question_en: How does context window size affect behavioral embeddings extracted from tafsir?

title: Embedding Quality Score
question_ar: Compute overall embedding quality score combining: opposite separation, similar clustering, category coherence, graph alignment.
question_en: Compute overall embedding quality score combining: opposite separation, similar clustering, category coherence, graph alignment.

title: The Complete Sabr Analysis
question_ar: Using ALL system components, generate the most comprehensive analysis of الصبر ever produced: 11-dimensional profile, all relationships, network position, cross-tafsir treatment, semantic neighbors, heart state correlation, consequences, and transformation pathways.
question_en: Using ALL system components, generate the most comprehensive analysis of الصبر ever produced: 11-dimensional profile, all relationships, network position, cross-tafsir treatment, semantic neighbors, heart state correlation, consequences, and transformation pathways.

title: Behavioral Prescription Generator
question_ar: Given behavioral profile {متكبر، حسود، قاسي القلب}, generate complete Quranically-grounded transformation plan: target behaviors, sequence, intermediate states, expected timeline, with verse and tafsir evidence.
question_en: Given behavioral profile {متكبر، حسود، قاسي القلب}, generate complete Quranically-grounded transformation plan: target behaviors, sequence, intermediate states, expected timeline, with verse and tafsir evidence.

title: The Quranic Behavioral Genome
question_ar: Export the complete behavioral DNA of the Quran: all 73 behaviors, all relationships, all dimensional attributes, all agents, all consequences, all provenance - in a single structured artifact.
question_en: Export the complete behavioral DNA of the Quran: all 73 behaviors, all relationships, all dimensional attributes, all agents, all consequences, all provenance - in a single structured artifact.

title: Comparative Surah Analysis
question_ar: Compare behavioral profiles of Surah Al-Baqarah vs Surah An-Nisa. How do their behavioral emphases differ?
question_en: Compare behavioral profiles of Surah Al-Baqarah vs Surah An-Nisa. How do their behavioral emphases differ?

title: Prophet Behavioral Comparison
question_ar: Compare behavioral profiles attributed to Ibrahim, Musa, and Isa. What's common? What's unique?
question_en: Compare behavioral profiles attributed to Ibrahim, Musa, and Isa. What's common? What's unique?

title: Historical Case Study: Firaun
question_ar: Generate complete behavioral analysis of فرعون: all mentioned behaviors, their relationships, consequences, and lessons.
question_en: Generate complete behavioral analysis of فرعون: all mentioned behaviors, their relationships, consequences, and lessons.

title: Behavioral Q&A Accuracy Test
question_ar: Answer 50 factual questions about Quranic behaviors with full provenance. Measure accuracy against scholar gold standard.
question_en: Answer 50 factual questions about Quranic behaviors with full provenance. Measure accuracy against scholar gold standard.

title: Relationship Prediction Validation
question_ar: Predict 20 behavior relationships not in training data. Have scholars validate predictions.
question_en: Predict 20 behavior relationships not in training data. Have scholars validate predictions.

title: Cross-Component Consistency Check
question_ar: Verify that all system components agree: graph relationships match tafsir evidence match embedding similarities.
question_en: Verify that all system components agree: graph relationships match tafsir evidence match embedding similarities.

title: Edge Case Handling
question_ar: Test system on edge cases: rare behaviors, disputed interpretations, behaviors with minimal evidence.
question_en: Test system on edge cases: rare behaviors, disputed interpretations, behaviors with minimal evidence.

title: Provenance Completeness Audit
question_ar: For every claim the system makes, verify complete provenance chain: verse → tafsir → extraction → annotation.
question_en: For every claim the system makes, verify complete provenance chain: verse → tafsir → extraction → annotation.

title: Scalability Test
question_ar: Can the system handle complex multi-part questions requiring 10+ component interactions?
question_en: Can the system handle complex multi-part questions requiring 10+ component interactions?

title: Explanation Quality
question_ar: For each answer, rate the quality of explanation: clarity, depth, accuracy, citations.
question_en: For each answer, rate the quality of explanation: clarity, depth, accuracy, citations.

title: Scholar Validation Protocol
question_ar: Submit 20 system outputs to Islamic scholars. Measure agreement rate and gather feedback.
question_en: Submit 20 system outputs to Islamic scholars. Measure agreement rate and gather feedback.

title: The Ultimate Question
question_ar: Describe the complete Quranic science of behavioral transformation: the principles, the mechanisms, the pathways, the evidence, the methods, and the expected outcomes - synthesized from the entire Quran and all tafsir sources, utilizing every component of the QBM system.
question_en: Describe the complete Quranic science of behavioral transformation: the principles, the mechanisms, the pathways, the evidence, the methods, and the expected outcomes - synthesized from the entire Quran and all tafsir sources, utilizing every component of the QBM system.
